metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40957 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Inconsistent data in instruction and data cache when creating wasm code could lead to a potentially exploitable crash.
*This bug only affects Firefox on ARM64 platforms.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.3, Thunderbird < 102.3, and Firefox < 105. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40957` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required
